USA: The Sixteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution, establishing an income tax, was ratified.
The Armory Show opened in New York City, introducing American and European modern art to the American public.
The Seventeenth Amendment to the United States Constitution, establishing direct election of Senators, was ratified.
After mass civilian casualties in the Battle of Bud Bagsak, the Moro's surrendered their rebellion, ending the Philippine–American War.
The Underwood Tariff was signed into law.
Henry Ford developed the modern assembly line.
The Federal Reserve Act was signed into law; establishing the Federal Reserve System.
Taiwan: Japanese forces engage in a subjugation campaign against aboriginals on the east coast
Hakka people rebel in Miaoli and are suppressed
Slovenia: Celje is electrified. Westen's dishes factory uses electricity in industry.

Ivan Cankar in Ljubljana gives a speech Slovenes and Yugoslavs for the socialist society Vzajemnost (Mutuality) about Slovenes to unite politically but not culturally with other South Slavs and Yugoslavism.
Philippine: Newton W. Gilbert appointed as acting Civil Governor (1913)
Francis Burton Harrison appointed as Civil Governor (1913–1921)
Ireland: A Dublin businessman, William Martin Murphy, fired forty workers he suspected of belonging to the Irish Transport and General Workers' Union (ITGWU).
Dublin Lockout: The ITGWU went on strike.
India: Rabindranath Tagore won Nobel Prize in Literature
Haiti: President Auguste dies during a visit to northern Haiti
Senator Michel Oreste is elected president by the Constituent Assembly
Germany: Saverne Affair: Two local Saverne papers reported on offensive comments made by a local Prussian military officer.
France: Raymond Poincaré began his term as president of France.
East_Timor: The Portuguese and Dutch agreed to a formal division of the island.
Cuba: The presidency of Mario García Menocal begins.
Brazil: Roosevelt–Rondon Scientific Expedition: Following a speaking tour in Brazil and Argentina, former US President Theodore Roosevelt meets up with Cândido Rondon to embark on a joint exploration of the "River of Doubt".
Belgium: Exposition universelle et internationale (1913), World's Fair in Ghent.
Bangladesh: Establishment of Ahmadiyya Muslim Community Bangladesh in Brahmanbaria
Australia: The foundation stone for the city of Canberra is put in place
Canberra is officially named as the Capital of Australia.
Australian federal election, 1913: Joseph Cook elected as the 6th Prime Minister of Australia.
Albania: First Balkan War: The Treaty of London ended the war.
Second Balkan War: The Treaty of Bucharest ended the war and recognized an independent Albanian state ruled by a constitutional monarchy.
